This CLEAN creative, comfortable, one bedroom, private loft apartment, is nestled above our sculpture studio/home, and is located in the heart of the artistic Mission. Enjoy fine art, a gourmet kitchen, large windows with northern light and a garden view, a king size bed, and a natural gas franklin stove. Near historic Rainbow Grocery, Heath Ceramics, artistic cafe's, local art galleries, theaters, and parks. Fits two. Hosted Rental. Not just a place to stay, this is an immersive art experience.

The space
Our one bedroom Artist's Loft is not just another place to sleep and work, it is a creative immersive art experience. We invite a responsible person, or a couple, to visit our beautiful, recently renovated, private apartment, nestled above our Art Studio. By staying with us in our Hosted Rental, you are invited as an artist and/or art patron-in-residence because by residing in our apartment you directly support art-in-the-making and have the chance to add to the creative flow and output. Feel free to write a poem, paint or sculpt if you feel inspired. You may observe art projects in progress from windows that look into the art studio or you may also draw the blinds for privacy. Guests may have tea or coffee with the artists, discuss art and get advice on local art happenings and installations in the area. Brian is available to give tours of his local art installations. The location is excellent, in the center of the arts & design quarter of the Mission, safe, with lots of character, surrounded by trees and some of the best restaurants, theaters, art galleries, cafes and shopping in San Francisco. There is a performance space next door where they sometimes have classes you may join. It is just a few blocks from the historic Rainbow Grocery Cooperative. The Mission is an international favorite neighborhood to explore local Murals. Our Loft is five blocks to bustling foodie friendly Valencia Street and the BART (the local subway) station. The neighborhood is a pleasant area to walk, bike and just 10min to downtown SF by BART. Our comfortable and unique apartment has been carefully furnished and decorated with contemporary art, artifacts and up-cycled materials such as salvaged bowling ally floors, reclaimed wood and fixtures, ancient Indian and Afghan doors. Staying here offers moments of being outside of the normal bounds of time, a mythical space where one may dive deep into a creative life in the arts.

Amenities:
- Spacious bedroom with king size bed and walk in closet
- Bathroom with claw-foot bathtub
- Sitting room with gas fireplace
- Garden View
- Large dining room table with space for 8 people.
- Full kitchen with dishwasher
- Laundry facilities
- Lots of natural light
- Maple, up-cycled, hardwood floors
- Street parking available
- We Artists live and work in the sculpture studio and salon below the apartment. This is a great opportunity for you to engage with the artistic process if you so desire. We also respect and protect your privacy.
-Spiral staircase with balcony view of the Sculpture studio.
-Visit Florencia's hair salon the "Sculpture Salon" in a well lit part of the studio. She specializes in artcentric color and cuts.
- Brian Goggin's sculpture website is:(listed under his name: Brian Goggin Artist) You can visit some of his public sculptures in San Francisco - "Language of the Birds" in North Beach, and "Caruso's Dream" in SOMA.
-Mailing address is: 499 Alabama St, Studio 123, San Francisco, CA 94110. Physical location is 401 Alabama St. Studio 123, San Francisco, CA 94110. If you are planning to receive packages please have the parcel addressed as follows: Brian Goggin, c/o Project Artaud Office, San Francisco, CA 94110 Attn: _(your name here)_

Where you’ll be

The location is excellent. The north-east Mission is in the center of the arts & design quarter of the Mission. It is safe, with lots of character, trees, and surrounded by active art studios, theaters, restaurants, art galleries and cafes. Just a few blocks from the historic Rainbow Grocery Coop. Some evenings there are performances in the theater space adjacent to our studio. If so they usually end by 10:30pm.

Favourites were: Gus’s organic supermarket, Tartine for great breakfasts and outstanding pastries, the Morris for a romantic meal, Yoga To The People for dynamic group classes, Valencia St for all types of food and quirky shops (especially Paxton Gate), the original Mission to see how San Francisco came to be formed. We also loved SFMoMA and the deYoung.

On a practical note.

GUSS supermarket across the road is your mini-Whole foods.
MUST MUST have at least one meal at Tartine Manufactory on Alabama St (food and COCKTAILS!).
"Foreign Cinema" restaurant (~15mins walk) impressed me with oysters and wine selection (reservation is a must).
True Laurel at Alabama st is the place to go for late drinks and food.

  1. September 2017

Brian's work adorns several parts of the city, and it was fascinating for me, as someone who studies urban issues, to see how a creative artist conceives of his role in a city like San Francisco. We had really interesting chats, and I wish we could have had more (though I am hoping to return to continue our conversations). This is a great airbnb rental: not only is the place itself great, but it could not be better located. You are a block from Tartine's, one of the best bakeries in the country, and a block in another direction from a great market, Gus's, which will have everything you need if you decide to eat in. (And the kitchen is perfectly equipped for that as well!). And within blocks in any directions lie the countless riches of the Mission -- interesting shops, myriad cafés, music venues, bars, etc. etc. But the special thing about Brian's place, one that really distinguishes it from other rentals, is the sense that you are being invited to take part either as an artist or a scholar in the creative enterprise. Brian and Florencia are perfectly discreet, and you will have complete privacy if that is what you wish -- but you will also be able to take part through discussion or through hands on participation in the creative process and energy that is palpable in every square inch of the place. Highly recommended for those who are looking for a little bit more from their airbnb rental.

I came to SF to work on a printing/design project for my family's business, Sachi Organics. To be at the artist residency was a true blessings. I was surrounded by such a creative space it helped to keep my focus on art and design while being in a great stylish setting. Brian let me use a little space in the studio to look over my fabric project and gave me some insight that was very helpful. The neighborhood was perfect, there is an organic grocery store called Gus's half a block down the street and the area is full of really cool cafe's, small production businesses, art studios, local bars and great restaurants. Brian can also recommend any place to eat or anything you need in the area or the City for that matter. The artist residency above Brian's studio is a great place for artist, designers, makers etc who are working on a project in the City or scouting different art/design places for ideas and inspiration. This was such a great experience and I can highly recommend the artist residency loft, the neighborhood and especially the hosts!!

Mission is a very artistic area, full with galleries and concept stores, bars and great restaurants, make sure to eat some delicious tacos at Tacolicious, or any Mexican restaurant you want, and drink a cup of coffee at Blue Bottle which is 2min walk from the apartment!

Mihali

  1. April 2016
Our 6 days in San Francisco were the highlight of our 4 week USA trip, and a big part of that was due to our time at Splendid!

Brian and Florencia stayed in touch in the lead up to our trip, and were super accommodating when we needed to add a day to the stay. On our arrival in San Fran they met us at the gate, gave us the grand tour, and were as welcoming and friendly as can be.

The apartment itself has so much character - from the stunning bedroom doors, to the 120-year-old toilet, to the view looking down into Brian and Flor's studio - but don't think that it doesn't have everything you need for a comfortable stay.

The bed is super comfy, and exactly what we needed after weeks of hotel beds. The kitchen is stocked up for all types of cooking, with all the pots and pans and cooking staples you could want. They also seem to have every kind of tea under the sun in a pantry as well! There is a community market around the corner with an excellent range of organic fruits and vegetables (and everything else too) if you're up for some cooking.

The washing machine and dryer were great too, a really useful touch to save us a trip or two to a laundromat.

The location is really cool, inside what is basically a compound full of artists of all types. A 10 minute walk gets you to Valencia Street with our new favourite Mexican restaurants (try Tacolicious for sure!) and cool shops, and Lyft gets you anywhere in about 10 mins also.

If you've got a full day to wander around, and some energy, we definitely recommend walking to the Golden Gate Park from the house - approx an 80-90 minute walk with some big hills in the way, but you walk through the Mission and Castro districts and finish up in a beautiful and scenic area around the park and UC San Fran.

Finally a beautiful touch from our amazing hosts - when they found out that my girlfriend and I actually got engaged on our last night in the apartment, they rushed out to get us some beautiful local wine to celebrate. The little things really do make a big difference.

Honestly, we couldn't recommend Brian and Flor and Splendid enough, do yourself a favour and book a stay!

Daniel

  1. November 2015
It was a long day roaming the streets of San Francisco on a crisp autumn evening. My girlfriend and I made the exhausting, though ultimately pleasant, mistake of traversing through the 70 degree hills of North Beach and Telegraph Hills for much of the afternoon. We were spent.

After hitting up a restaurant and with the sun’s perspicacity fading, I looked to my partner with a sort of quizzical expression, asking silently if it was time to call it a day.

“Yeah, let’s go home”

The “home” in question would be Florencia and Brian’s wonderful space, the aptly named Splendid. This being my first experience with Airbnb, I was reticent about the whole enterprise. After all, most media outlets are keener to highlight disastrous vacation stories rather than those Perfectly Acceptable ones. Yet to suggest that what Florencia and Brian offer is “Perfectly Acceptable” would be a great disservice to the kind of distinct and memorable experience they provide.

A delayed flight prevented us from getting to the site on time – to which Florencia and Brian were able to accommodate. Brian greeted us upon our arrival, giving us a tour of his artist’s space and the living/loft space found above. With a delightful French bulldog in tow, Beto, he assisted with our luggage up the spiral staircase and offered his share of anecdotes about the space and its esoteric offerings.

First and foremost: this is an artist’s space. During our stay, Brian was in the midst of working on a commissioned project for the SF Fire Department, a fusion of Indian architecture and contemporary design of impressive scope. As my girlfriend and I would leave the loft for our expeditions through the city we would often encounter Brain diligently at work in the studio. Yet never did we get the sense that we were impeding on his space nor was he in ours. There’s a friendliness and warmth that’s cultivated here and I can only assume it’s amplified the closer your neural tendencies jibe with Florencia and Brian’s sensibilities.

The living space is as terrific as advertised. A cozy living room space with a fireplace found my girlfriend and I end our terrific nights by the fireside, reading whatever books we picked up at City Lights. There's a massive kitchen that makes the thought of home cooking not daunting, but actually welcoming. The comfort of our quarters and the affability of our hosts made our stay in San Francisco perfect. It felt like home.

Steve

  1. September 2014
The pictures do not do this place justice. This place is incredible - one of the coolest, nicest places I've stayed in ever. Any trip I make to SF from here on out I will always check to see if this unit is available.

High ceilings. Exposed pipes. Gorgeous loft windows. Wood floors made out of former bowling alley floors. Incredible gourmet kitchen. It's high end all the way but antique pieces have been reused to give the unit amazing charm. The toilet is 100 years old - totally functional - but the tank sits above the toilet and has a cool old chain you pull to flush. Claw foot bathtub. Tons of closet space off the bedroom.

And the bed is super comfortable. I slept very well, from the very day I arrived. Quiet neighborhood.

The unit's entrance is actually above an artists working space, so you need to enter into the artists studio, then walk up a circular staircase to get to the apartment. Sometimes there are folks working in the studio - so you may see people coming or going but it wasn't an issue at all for me. Brian and his colleague were super chill, friendly and left me to do my thing.

What an awesome place, I was showing pictures to all my friends who couldn't believe what a deal it was. You won't regret staying here.

  1. June 2014
My friend Ariel and I stayed in this perfect one bedroom for 5 days while visiting a friend in San Francisco. We were both instantly charmed and delighted by the apartment's unique and artistic decor.

I felt incredibly comfortable in the apartment - the bed is particularly comfortable! The posting & pictures are very accurate (minus a different toilet - very funky & cool!) The bathroom has a great shower. All around, very spacious. We never felt cramped.

I wish I had a chance to utilize the kitchen more, but there is plenty of equipment to cook, if desired.

Florencia & Brian were incredibly nice, easy-going, and available to help. Ariel and I never felt like they were intruding on our space. As stated in many reviews, the apartment is located above Brian's studio. He was there sometimes, but never disruptive or loud. The dog, Beto, is also incredibly sweet and adorable.

The neighborhood is diverse and has a lot of art spaces and studios, along with a surprising number of animal-related facilities (SPCA, pet hospital, vet, dog boutique, etc.) The apartment is about a 10-15 minute walk from the BART station (16th & Mission) and nearby to a number of busses.

This apartment would be ideal for a couple or two very good friends to share while on a trip to San Francisco. The only thing I didn't LOVE, was the window into the bathroom. The window is between the bedroom and the bathroom, and while the glass/material was distorted and you could not see directly in/out - you could still see a person moving around from both points of view. It was not an issue for us - but I would understand why it could be.

All in all, my first Airbnb experience was a huge success. Florencia & Brian were very nice and have a beautiful apartment that acts as a wonderful respite in a busy city. I really loved all of the unique touches in the apartment - like the tiled sink, collection of antiques, and all-around great style.

A+!

Florence and Brian's apartment is spectacular, warm, well decorated, and with all the amenities you could want. It's even prettier than the pictures. It was always really fun to walk through Brian's workshop and check out his sculptures and work in progress. Florence was very kind and attentive to us, she advised us at all times about the apartment, nearby restaurants and points of interest in the city. There is an organic supermarket and high quality local products around the corner that we enjoyed very much and that we became fans. We spent the end of the year in the apartment and Brian gave us a bottle of wine to celebrate. The truth is, in general, living in his apartment was an experience worth repeating.
